title: Olt to be honored as Rangers' top Minor Leaguer
body: ARLINGTON -- Infielder Mike Olt has been named the winner of the 2012 Tom Grieve Award as the Rangers' top Minor League player. He will be honored at the Dr Pepper Awards Show, which will be held next Friday at the Arlington Convention Center.  The Rangers will also honor three other Minor League players. Cody Buckel will receive the Nolan Ryan Pitcher of the Year Award, outfielder Engel Beltre is the Defender of the Year and pitcher Ben Rowen is the Reliever of the Year.  Olt played in 95 games at Double-A Frisco before being called up to the Rangers, hitting .288 with 28 home runs, 82 RBIs and a .579 slugging percentage. He was selected to play in the Texas League All-Star Game and the All-Star Futures Game.
